topic: Deep dive: sunau standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: sunau standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: Sunau Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an in-depth overview of the Sunau standard library module, a powerful tool for audio file manipulation in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Sunau is a lightweight and efficient library for handling various audio formats
It supports multiple formats including WAV, MP3, OGG, AIFF, and more
Sunau provides functions for reading and writing audio files, as well as for playing sounds directly
The library can be used to extract audio data from files, modify it, and then write the changes back to a file

code_examples.code:
import sunau

sound = sunau.WaveFileOpen('example.wav', 'r')

data, subchunk2 = sound.read_frames(sound.gettotalsamples())

version_notes: Sunau is a new module introduced in Python 3.12+
It offers improved performance and expanded support for audio formats compared to previous audio-related libraries
caveats: As a relatively new library, Sunau may not have as much community support or third-party packages built around it as more established libraries
Ensure that your system has the necessary dependencies installed for working with specific audio formats
